answers.answer: Oh - I'm 42. Now I know why they say life begins at 40!

I have just put a post below yours called Post Prandiel but I am the same my fasting test was 112 then 115 yesterday they said it wasnt diabetes, but its pre and unstable sugar levels, I feel sick and disorientated after eating so it seems to be Hypoglycemic ,I am also doing reasearch into Lyme disease

I was told the same thing by my doctor to just eat well and exercise.With me it was not what I ate that gave me type ll but how I ate.I eat healthy food but, have to remind myself to eat a breakfast lunch and dinner, along with snacks during the day.  I used to eat mainly just dinner.  Now I eat at least 3 times daily even if I have to force myself.I also found out just lately that when you have a bad cold and are not feeling well your sugar can climb higher.I don't know if this helped or not.  Just my two cents.  And yes....LOL  That was my thought to on life begins at 40 also, unfortunately time stamp for me started at 30.  ;-/  LOLBest of wishes to you.

question: I'm new here but post on the thyroid forum often.My FASTING glucose level has been in the mid to upper 90's for about five years and this time it was 100 in a (range of 65-99 mg/dl considered normal). Other than Hoshimoto's thyroiditis  (hypo auto immune thyroid) I have been well my whole life.My cholesterol labs are good. I am not over weight, and I have not eaten junk food in five years. I am fairly lean with a body mass index of 12. But my blood glucose keeps climbing. Why???I see an endo for my thyroid in two weeks:- what do I need to ask about my elevating glucose ?-What is this glucose test I have heard about?-what can I do to avoid diabetes that the docs dont stress, they just say eat well and exercise? - I always do!Having Hoshimotos is bad enough, I want to do as much as possible to lower my glucose.Thanks
title: Glucose of 100, on edge of  pre-diabetes? how?
